p: One strategy to reduce phytate in cereals/pseudocereals includes treatments, such as soaking and malting ( 94) or germination ( 234, 235), that activate phytases present in plants ( 236). However, this activity is considered insufficient to eliminate the phytate present in these substrates ( 237). Recent research has shown that microbial sources are more promising for the production of phytases on a commercial level and in cereal based foods ( 238, 239).
